verses.text: These are the kings of the land whom the Israelites struck down, and whose land they took possession of beyond the Jordan toward the rising of the sun, from the Valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon, including all the eastern Arabah.
verses.comment: Retains listing structure; 'beyond the Jordan toward the rising of the sun' means east of the Jordan.

verses.text: Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, ruled from Aroer on the edge of the Valley of the Arnon, and from the middle of the valley, and half of Gilead, even as far as the river Jabbok, the border of the Ammonites;
verses.comment: Lists geographical extent of Sihon's rule.

verses.text: and over the eastern Arabah as far as the Sea of Chinnereth eastward, and as far as the Sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, eastward by the road to Beth-jeshimoth, and southward below the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.comment: 'Sea of Chinnereth' is the Sea of Galilee; 'Salt Sea' is the Dead Sea.

verses.text: And Og king of Bashan, one of the remnant of the Rephaim, who lived at Ashtaroth and at Edrei,
verses.comment: Og described as last of the Rephaim (giants) per tradition.

verses.text: ruled over Mount Hermon and Salecah and all Bashan, as far as the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and half of Gilead to the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
verses.comment: Lists specific territories under Og's rule.

verses.text: Moses the servant of the LORD and the Israelites defeated them, and Moses the servant of the LORD gave their land as a possession to the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.comment: Clarifies Moses's role and land distribution.

verses.text: And these are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the Israelites struck down on the west side of the Jordan, from Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak that goes up to Seir. Joshua gave their land as a possession to the tribes of Israel according to their allotments,
verses.comment: Joshua's conquests are summarized; territorial limits given.

verses.text: in the hill country, in the lowland, in the Arabah, on the slopes, in the wilderness, and in the Negev—the land of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites:
verses.comment: Lists six groups inhabiting the conquered lands.

verses.text: the king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one;
verses.comment: Begins list of individual kings defeated; 'one' denotes each king.

verses.text: the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;
verses.comment: Jerusalem and Hebron among major cities listed.

verses.text: the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;
verses.comment: Both cities were part of southern coalition.

verses.text: the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;
verses.comment: Continues record of conquered kings.

verses.text: the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;
verses.comment: Debir also called Kirjath-sepher; Geder is obscure in location.

verses.text: the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;
verses.comment: Hormah and Arad referenced from previous battles.

verses.text: the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;
verses.comment: Both towns were part of the southern campaign.

verses.text: the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;
verses.comment: Bethel previously allied or close to Ai.

verses.text: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
verses.comment: 'Tappuah' and 'Hepher' are somewhat uncertain in location.

verses.text: the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;
verses.comment: Aphek is likely a city in Sharon plain; Lasharon's location debated.

verses.text: the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;
verses.comment: Hazor was a major northern Canaanite center.

verses.text: the king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;
verses.comment: Names may be compound or tribal; northern campaign.

verses.text: the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
verses.comment: Taanach and Megiddo notable for later battles (Judges, Revelation).

verses.text: the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
verses.comment: Kedesh in Naphtali; Jokneam near Mount Carmel.

verses.text: the king of Dor in Naphath-dor, one; the king of Goiim in Gilgal, one;
verses.comment: 'Dor in Naphath-dor' region on the coast; 'Goiim' is 'nations.'

verses.text: the king of Tirzah, one—all the kings, thirty-one in total.
verses.comment: Final verse sums the tally: 31 kings in all.
